intro: Ophiorrhiza longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered marsh bean, is a tropical shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it is typically found in wet, swampy areas. Its fruits are small capsules that release seeds when mature. Ophiorrhiza longiflora is often used in traditional medicine and is adapted to thrive in humid, low-light environments.
